Arrays are one of the first data structures that you will be introduced to first for primitive data types and then objects. If you have some basic programming experience then you should already have met the materials with in this topic. 
 
 Below is a brief overview of each of the topics covered in this topic: 
 
 Declaring Arrays of Length - Learn to declare an array of a fixed length. 
 
 Declaring Array with values - Learn to declare an array with values on declaration. 
 
 Different Arrays - Learn what types of Arrays there is. 
 
 Sorting - Learn how to sort an array in different orders. 
 
 Searching - Learn how to efficacy search an array.

LinkedLists are an implementation of a list and the way javas standard library does this is in a doubly linked list of nodes. However before we get too in depth lets revise what a list is. 
 
 NEEDS TO BE CHANGED / REMOVED AS ARRAYLISTS ARE NOT COVERED IN APP As seen before in ArrayList a list is a sequence of elements where each element has a position in the list and elements can be repeated within the list. LinkedList and ArrayList are both ways of storing a list but have different implementations that lead to different advantages and disadvantages which will be outlined with in all topics of LinkedLists. 
 
 SHOULD BE MOVED TO DECLARING A LINKEDLIST LinkedLists can be implemented in one of two ways through a singly or doubly linked list of nodes. A node is a data structure that contains an element with is an item for a type the list wants to store and a connection with the next node. Below you will see a simple implementation of a node using T as a generic type.

Through the topics and examples give in this topic we will use singly linked nodes till doubly linked are needed. 
 
 The topics covered within LinkedLists are: 
 
 Declaring a LinkedList - Learn how to declare a LinkedList and how it works with nodes. 
 
 Adding to A LinkedList - Learn about adding to an item and a node to a LinkedList 
 
 Removing from a LinkedList - Learn about the process of removing an node from a LinkedList and the problems you have to live with. 
 
 Rotating a LinkedList - learn how to alter a LinkedList of the items are rotated around themselves.
